{"step_by_step_thinking": "Proprioception is the sense of self-movement and body position. It is mediated by proprioceptors, mechanosensory neurons located within muscles, tendons, and joints. Proprioception of the head stems from the muscles innervated by the trigeminal nerve. The facial nerve, glossopharyngeal nerve, and cranial accessory nerve are not mentioned in the documents as carrying proprioception from the head and neck.", "answer_choice": "A. Facial nerve, C. Glossopharyngeal nerve, D. Cranial accessory nerve"}
